thread.title: Storm Alert: Andalusia Braces for Severe Weather as Red and Orange Warnings Issued
thread.title_full: Storm Alert: Andalusia Braces for Severe Weather as Red and Orange Warnings Issued

author: newsdirectory3
title: Storm Alert: Andalusia Braces for Severe Weather as Red and Orange Warnings Issued
text:
The Spanish Meteorological Agency has issued an important weather update, issuing red and orange warning codes in the Autonomous Community of Andalucia, especially for the province of Huelva and its coastal area. The warning is valid for Friday and refers to heavy rain, significant water falls and intensifying winds in the Autonomous Community of Andalusia.
The Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MAE) is advising Romanian citizens in Andalucia, whether they are traveling or planning to travel to the region, to be aware of these severe weather conditions.
Recommendations for Romanians in the region The Consulate General of Romania in Seville recommends avoiding non -urgent travel and offers Romanian citizens a telephone number for consular assistance: +34 954 233 243, +34 954 230 947, +34 954 624 053 and +34 954 624 070. The calls are redirected to the Contact and Support Center for Foreign Citizens of Romania (CCSCRS), where operators are available 24/7.
In cases of emergency, Romanian citizens can contact the Consulate General on the emergency number +34 648 212 169. The MAE also recommends consulting the official websites for updated weather information and consular assistance , including www.meteoalarm.org a www.mae.ro .
